entry.title: Joining AppProva
entry.content: On February of 2018 I decided to leave my old job to pursue new goals. I was there for about two and a half years, and it was time to part ways. I’ve being focusing on DevOps space in the last couple of years. I’ve even become a Meetup organizer...

entry.title: Books I've read in 2017.
entry.content:
Continuing with the tradition of posting the list of books I’ve read on the current year here is the list of books I’ve read in 2017:

  • Eclesiastes – Rei Salomão
  • Arábia: A Incrível História De Um Brasileiro no Oriente Médio – Raiam dos Santos

entry.title: Books I've read in 2016.
entry.content: One of my goals every year is to read more books. I read a lot I must say but it is always good to read more and add knowledge to your brain. After I’ve found Audible things got easier. I can listen to an Audiobook while I’m at the gym...

entry.title: Serving static files in Django with WhiteNoise
entry.content:
Hi, in this post I’m going to show you how to use WhiteNoise to serve static files in a Django app. WhiteNoise is a library built to radically simplify static file serving for Python web applications.

With a couple of lines of config WhiteNoise allows your web app to serve...

entry.title: Python Generators
entry.content:
I’m the Generator, firing whenever you quit Yeah whatever it is, you go out and it’s on
Yeah can’t you hear my motored heart You’re the one that started it

entry.title: How to setup ATOM as your Python development environment
entry.content:
PyCharm is an awesome IDE for Python Development and I use it a lot. But sometimes it gets soooo heavier that I want to kill myself. Then I’ve found ATOM. ATOM is a coding editor created by the GitHub team with the goal to be simple, powerful and highly customizable.

...

entry.title: Blog Posts & Podcasts que influenciaram a minha carreira
entry.content: Sabemos que cada ser humano é moldado pelo meio que vive, por aquilo que vê, por aquilo que escuta, por aquilo que consome e pelas experiências que vive!
